page.title: 08FARMING 2
page.content: Two farmers' wives still run turkeys for the Christmas trade, buying in 300 young turkeys in August for fattening. This practice is not as common as it was, because the new generation does not wish to be involved in so much work. There is a very large pig farm in High Offley . It has two acres of pig units containing 4000 pigs which are Large White X Landrace. Breeding sows are kept for three or four years before being sent to be made into pork pies. The young pigs are sent for slaughter at about 20 weeks. This farm also produces sugar beet as a cash crop. There is one market garden of 4 acres with one third of an acre under glass producing tomatoes. Lettuce, salad onons and rhubarb are also grown.
